result.execSummary:
The defendant Salethian D Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Def to pay mandatory Court costs/fees of $443 plus Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100 for a total of $543.  Financial obligation is due in one year from today but if def has had no law enforcement involvement at home involving alcohol, the Court will amend the JOC to Remit all Court costs/fees and sentence will be amended to 2 days County Jail - TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Salethian D Hayes
